data.title: 'I Never Shared This Story Before': Sally Field Reveals Robin Williams' Touching Act of Kindness
meta_keywords: what did sally field say about robin Williams
data.meta_description: In a heartfelt revelation, actress Sally Field shared a moving story about the late Robin Williams during the filming of the beloved movie Mrs. Doubtfire.
data.text:
In a heartfelt revelation, actress Sally Field shared a moving story about the late Robin Williams during the filming of the beloved movie Mrs. Doubtfire.

The story, which she recently recounted to Vanity Fair on the 10th anniversary of Williams' passing, highlights a lesser-known side of the legendary actorâ€”his deep sensitivity and intuition.

By Rhododendrites | By Kingkongphoto & celebrity-photos.com

Field described a day on set when she received devastating news: her father had passed away after suffering a stroke.

Despite her grief, Field tried to continue working, but Williams immediately sensed something was wrong. He gently pulled her aside, asked if she was okay, and upon learning of her loss, insisted that she be allowed to leave the set.

Sally recounted the story to Vanity Fair as follows:

"Robin came over, pulled me out of the set, and asked, 'Are you okay?'"

Sally: "Yes, why?"

Robin: "I don't know, just thought [I'd ask] that."

Sally: "No, I'm not, Robin. My father just passed."

Robin: "Oh my God, we need to get you out here right now."

Thanks to Williams' insistence, Field was able to return home, contact her brother, and make arrangements for her father. Reflecting on that moment, she noted, "It's a side of Robin that people rarely knew: He was very sensitive and intuitive."

Robin passed away on August 11, 2014.
